meanings.definition: The quality or fact of being very determined; determination.
meanings.sent1: Her tenacity in pursuing her dreams paid off in the end.
meanings.sent2: His tenacity in finishing the marathon impressed everyone.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel showed great tenacity in trying to reach the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The tenacity of the roots kept the tree firmly in place during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The tenacity of the detective solved the mystery in record time.

meanings.definition: The quality of holding together firmly; firmness.
meanings.sent1: The tenacity of the glue kept the broken pieces of the vase together.
meanings.sent2: The tenacity of the rope prevented the boat from drifting away.
meanings.sent3: The tent's tenacity withstood the strong winds during the camping trip.
meanings.sent4: The tenacity of the spider's web caught the unsuspecting fly.
meanings.sent5: The tenacity of the handshake showed the strength of their agreement.
